definition: complete change from the normal state (idiom); quite uncharacteristic/entirely outside the norm/out of character
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: Her temper's been very changeable this week so don't annoy her.
sentences.chinese: 本周她的脾气一反常态，因此不要招惹她。

sentences.english: In those circumstances Nixon reversed his attitude toward my growing celebrity .
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，尼克松对我的声名鹊起完全一反常态。

sentences.english: As the years went by, the Duke of Windsor rejigged his version of history.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间流逝，温莎公爵一反常态，改写历史。

sentences.english: The moon shone tonight, and its light was not of a customary kind.
sentences.chinese: 今夜月光如水，那亮光一反常态。

sentences.english: She seemed abnormal, and quite silent along the way.
sentences.chinese: 路上，她一反常态，竟非常沉默。

definition: unprecedented/for the first time/never before/first ever
always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
